      • RemoveConflictTask

        public void RemoveConflictTask()

        MULTI-AGENT SYSTEM : Addresses conflicts between agents in a multi-agent environment

        This prevents any two tankers from having the same tasks in its belief state.

        This is possible as all tankers are connected by an interface call InteractProtocol.

        For more information about it see InteractProtocol

      • printAgentTasks

        public void printAgentTasks()

        MULTI-AGENT SYSTEM. Prints out the tasks that the tanker was assigned to from a Role

        For more information, see Role

      • getNearestTask

        public dTask getNearestTask(posXY pos)
        gets nearest task from a specific position within reach from pump. Dont think this was used in the final implementation
        Parameters:
        pos - Reference position to get the nearest task
        Returns:
        Nearest Task to the position given

      • getTankerPosition

        public posXY getTankerPosition()

      • getNearestTask

        public dTask getNearestTask()
        returns the nearest task. A clear example of censoring through the Control System. Tasks beyond the range of the tanker and task more than the current water level is censored.
        Returns:
        the nearest task explored

      • getNearestWell

        public dWell getNearestWell()
        returns the nearest well from the tanker. A clear example of censoring through the Control System. Wells beyond the range of the tanker is censored. This lead to a bug where the tanker does not see any wells that are within its reach. The alternative will be trying to get the nearest well from the fuel pump, hence leading the tanker back to the fuel pump and to the well. Else there's need to do mnore exploration
        Returns:
        the nearest well explored

      • printCurrentRole

        public void printCurrentRole()

      • RequestHarvest

        public void RequestHarvest()
        MULTI-AGENT SYSTEM : The tanker checks if it needs help from other agent. To do so, the tanker joins the OpenSystem and posts a Harvest request to complete half of the available tasks. As the cost of requesting for help, It assigns the other half of those tasks to itself as a Role to be completed For more information, see Harvest, OpenSystem, and Role

      • OpenSysCheck

        private void OpenSysCheck()

        MULTI-AGENT SYSTEM : Checks if the agent needs to join the Open System or leaves the Open System.

        The requirements here determines what are the conditions that the tanker should join the Open System or the condition if the tanker should leave the Open System.

        To prevent conflict between roles in Open System and tanker's belief state, both must be updated to prevent clashing or attempting to complete a completed task.

        Joining the OpenSystem returns an Agent object. Agent acts as a "key" to retrieve information from the Open System.

        A tanker is only considered to be in the Open System iff it has an Agent object distributed by the Open System.

        For more information, see OpenSystem, Agent, and RequestHarvest()

      • getOutput

        public uk.ac.nott.cs.g54dia.multilibrary.Action getOutput()
        Control System chooses output between reactive layer and deliberative layer here. This is where Control System is able to choose which action between Reactive Layer and Deliberative Layer as the final output. Once chosen, the Model Layer will be updated with the action's movement direction.
        Returns:
        Output Action

      • ConvertPosToDir

        private int ConvertPosToDir(posXY pos)
        Conversion between position and direction for ease of use
        Parameters:
        pos - position to be converted for direction
        Returns:
        Converted direction from given position
